intro: Physaria rubicundula, commonly known as the redstem sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils, and is adapted to survive in harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters and range in color from pink to red. Physaria rubicundula plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various insects and small animals.
